snippet: Remarks by Premier Li Keqiang on Wednesday reflected the difficult — some say unsustainable — policy combination that China’s leaders hope to achieve.
abstract: Chinese Premier Li Keqiang warns that country must avoid mass unemployment that will result from failing mines and factories as country pares back production of coal and steel to respond to lack of demand; comments reflect challenge Li and Pre Xi Jinping face as they seek to avoid economic disruption while significantly reducing surplus industrial capacity.

byline.original: By CHRIS BUCKLEY and JAVIER C. HERNÁNDEZ

lead_paragraph: Remarks by Premier Li Keqiang on Wednesday reflected the difficult — some say unsustainable — policy combination that China’s leaders hope to achieve.

headline.main: China Seeks to Avoid Mass Layoffs While Cutting Production
headline.print_headline: China Hopes to Avoid Layoffs and Cut Surplus
